title: DeleteRangeCF error when enabling pruning

labels.name: icebox
labels.description: items that need more consideration, time, or can wait

body:
### Description
As a user, I want to have the node open up the http rpc interface once synced 

### Acceptance Criteria
* Service listening on specified port

### Steps to Reproduce (Bug)
1. Start full pruned sync on Rinkeby testnet
2. Wait until caught up with current head
3. Attempt to connect to RPC interface. 

**Expected behavior:**
Connection opens

**Actual behavior:**
Connection refused

**Frequency:** 100%

### Versions (Add all that apply)
* Software version: [`besu/v21.1.0-RC2/linux-x86_64/oracle_openjdk-java-15`]
* Java version: [`OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM (build 15.0.2+7-27, mixed mode, sharing)`]
* OS Name & Version: Docker, host is Debian 10 / Debian 11
* Kernel Version: [`Linux 5.9.0-5-amd64 #1 SMP Debian 5.9.15-1 x86_64 GNU/Linux`]
* Docker Version: [`20.10.2`]

### Additional Information

Running on self-managed hardware/OS (not cloud/vm) in docker. Local DNS is working. State is stored on a local zfs volume.

There seems to be some issue with the node not being able to tranbsition to stynced state once caught up, it throws some errors and then continues to download and sync new blocks, with the number of connected peers increasing as expected and by the looks of it, it's keeping up with current head of chain.

```
main | INFO  | AbstractAltBnPrecompiledContract | Using LibEthPairings native alt bn128
```

### Environment variables:

```
BESU_DATA_PATH=/besu/data
BESU_GRAPHQL_HTTP_HOST=0.0.0.0
BESU_METRICS_PORT=25943
BESU_NAT_METHOD=NONE
BESU_NETWORK=rinkeby
BESU_P2P_HOST=REDACTED
BESU_P2P_INTERFACE=0.0.0.0
BESU_P2P_PORT=REDACTED
BESU_PID_PATH=/tmp/pid
BESU_PRUNING_BLOCKS_RETAINED=10000
BESU_PRUNING_ENABLED=true
BESU_RPC_HTTP_HOST=0.0.0.0
BESU_RPC_HTTP_PORT=26695
BESU_RPC_WS_HOST=0.0.0.0
BESU_RPC_WS_PORT=8546
BESU_SYNC_MODE=FAST
```

```
# netstat -tanpu | grep LISTEN
tcp        0      0 0.0.0.0:$P2P_PORT           0.0.0.0:*               LISTEN      -
```
The error, if related, seems to come from here:  https://github.com/facebook/rocksdb/blob/master/include/rocksdb/write_batch.h#L226

Thanks @shemnon , that was it for the RPC :flushed: 

The DeleteRangeCF error seems related to pruning - it disappears if I disable pruning, so seems like that's not functional.
I've flagged it internally.  It's curious because all our local pruning nodes never complained.  Seems to be related to column families.
Let me know if there's anything I can do to help with debugging. For the time being I have the space to spare so I'll keep it running like this.

Started a fresh mainnet full sync on v21.1.2 (official docker image) with `--pruning-enabled=true` and `--sync-mode=FULL`, same error after the first 1000 blocks:

```
eth1_1    | 2021-03-17 13:28:51.135+00:00 | EthScheduler-Services-5 (importBlock) | INFO  | FullImportBlockStep | Import reached block 1000 (0x5b45..5d58), - Mg/s, Peers: 4
eth1_1    | 2021-03-17 13:28:54.782+00:00 | EthScheduler-Services-5 (importBlock) | INFO  | Pruner | Begin sweeping unused nodes for pruning. Keeping full state for blocks 1 to 1025
eth1_1    | 2021-03-17 13:28:55.143+00:00 | StatePruning-2 | ERROR | Besu | Uncaught exception in thread "StatePruning-2"
eth1_1    | org.hyperledger.besu.plugin.services.exception.StorageException: org.rocksdb.RocksDBException: DeleteRangeCF not implemented
eth1_1    |     at org.hyperledger.besu.plugin.services.storage.rocksdb.segmented.RocksDBColumnarKeyValueStorage.clear(RocksDBColumnarKeyValueStorage.java:211)

eth1_1    | 2021-03-17 13:28:55.366+00:00 | EthScheduler-Services-5 (importBlock) | INFO  | FullImportBlockStep | Import reached block 1200 (0x838b..b869), - Mg/s, Peers: 4
```

Edit: Tested with official docker image `Starting Besu version: besu/v21.1.2/linux-x86_64/oracle_openjdk-java-11` and docker source build `Starting Besu version: besu/v21.1.2/linux-x86_64/oracle_openjdk-java-14`, same exception on initial mainnet full sync with pruning for both. This should be easy to reproduce.

We're working on an overhaul to how we structure our database that should make pruning like this a thing of the past. I haven't looked into this but I'm assuming this could be a zfs issue? I recommend turning pruning off for the time being.

I canâ€™t see this being a ZFS issue. DeleteRangeCF is a DB function isnâ€™t it?

Plus, I think I tested it on a VPS, no ZFS there. The file system is just a file system, standard Linux fare.

Perhaps you're right but I jumped to that being the likely case since delete range has never given us issues and it sounds like it might be because there's some non-standard call that perhaps zfs doesn't implement so rocksdb then says it's not implemented. Again, perhaps you're right but since our new Bonsai Tries database format is our main focus right now, there might not be a fix to this until that becomes production ready.

Same problem here with:
```
      - "--sync-mode=FAST"
      - "--pruning-enabled=true"
      - "--pruning-blocks-retained=1024"
```

The node was previously configured with 2048 retained blocks, reduced that to 1024.

The disk usage is still 1.4TB - obviously the pruning does not work at all!? ðŸ¤”

Build from source v 21.7.3.
--network=mainnet --sync-mode=FAST --pruning-enabled=true
Get same error always when restarting besu.
